summary: This is an email chain from October 2019 between U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and DOJ officials Seth DuCharme and Jeff Favitta. They are scheduling a visit by the Attorney General to the SDNY office, discussing timing conflicts due to Yom Kippur, and proposing to brief the AG on the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Yom Kippur Scheduling Conflict
events.description: Berman notes that Wednesday, October 9, 2019 (Yom Kippur) is not a good day for the AG to visit SDNY as he and key staff (including Audrey, Laura Birger, and Jeff Oestericher) will be out observing the holiday.

locations: SDNY (Southern District of New York) office
keyFacts: In early October 2019, high-level DOJ officials were planning for the Attorney General to be briefed on the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
The scheduling was complicated by the Jewish holiday Yom Kippur on October 9, 2019, which would cause the absence of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and several of his top SDNY division chiefs.

The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (Berman) and the Office of the Attorney General (DuCharme, Favitta) regarding the AG's visit agenda.
